revised_title: Damage Tolerant Fiber Reinforced Sheet Metal Composites: A New Approach to Reinforcement
tldr: This article presents a new approach to designing fiber-reinforced sheet metal composites that can be fabricated using conventional sheet metal shaping and joining techniques. The primary reinforcing members do not fracture, providing a residual fail-safe characteristic and inhibiting crack growth in the metal sheet through strain energy reduction and frictional energy losses. This damage-tolerant composite system has potential applications in engineering and structural components.
